referencerule.name: WCF Contract Objects
referencerule.comment: Prevents removal of types and members decorated with OperationContract, ServiceContract, DataContract, or DataMember attributes.

referencerule.name: Auto-generated ResourceManager
referencerule.comment: Exclude resource classes which are auto-generated by Visual Studio. It uses reflection to create an instance of ResourceManager based on the class's name specified by a string value.

referencerule.name: Types and fields marked as serializable
referencerule.comment: Exclude all serializable types. This also excludes all serializable fields from renaming.

type.comment: Exclude all serializable types. This also excludes all serializable fields from renaming.

referencerule.name: Types with System.Web.Services attributes
referencerule.comment: Exclude all types that are decorated with attributes from the System.Web.Services namespace.

type.comment: Exclude all types that are decorated with attributes from the System.Web.Services namespace.

referencerule.name: Methods with System.Web.Services attributes
referencerule.comment: Exclude all methods that are decorated with attributes from the System.Web.Services namespace.

type.comment: Exclude all methods that are decorated with attributes from the System.Web.Services namespace.

referencerule.name: Fields with AccessedThroughPropertyAttribute
referencerule.comment: Exclude fields that are decorated with an AccessedThroughPropertyAttribute from the System.Runtime.CompilerServices namespace. In Visual Basic, any accessible WithEvents property contains a private field that has this attribute. This attribute is not stripped out during compilation so that it may be examined by other assemblies via reflection, so this rule need only be used when in Library mode.

type.comment: Exclude fields that are decorated with an AccessedThroughPropertyAttribute from the System.Runtime.CompilerServices namespace. In Visual Basic, any accessible WithEvents property contains a private field that has this attribute. This attribute is not stripped out during compilation so that it may be examined by other assemblies via reflection, so this rule need only be used when in Library mode.

referencerule.name: Fields of Silverlight and WPF UserControls
referencerule.comment: Exclude all fields of types with a supertype of System.Windows.Controls.UserControl.

referencerule.name: CrystalReport ReportClass Objects
referencerule.comment: Excludes all types with a supertype of CrystalDecisions.CrystalReports.Engine.ReportClass

type.comment: Excludes all types with a supertype of CrystalDecisions.CrystalReports.Engine.ReportClass

referencerule.name: Auto-generated Application settings
referencerule.comment: Excludes all types with a supertype of System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase

referencerule.name: Windows Workflow Activities
referencerule.comment: Excludes all types with a supertype of System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity

referencerule.name: Windows Phone Scheduled Tasks Agents
referencerule.comment: Excludes all types with a supertype of Microsoft.Phone.Scheduler.ScheduledTaskAgent

referencerule.name: Properties of anonymous types with CompilerGeneratedAttribute
referencerule.comment: Excludes all properties of anonymous types that have the System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CompilerGeneratedAttribute
